fields.text: Tell the client that you would like to speak to her/him more about her/his reproductive goals and fertility desires to help her/him choose the best method for her/him.

EXPLAIN: The methods I can give you today include:
combined oral contraceptives
progestin only pills
female condoms
male condoms
standard days method
Methods for referral:
lactational amenorrhea method (LAM)
injection
implants
interuterineintrauterine device (IUD)
emergency contractptioncontraception
tubal litigation
vasectomy

fields.label: ASK: Do you want to have children in the future?

fields.text:
Explain that permanent methods of contraception will not work because she/he wants a child in the future.
Set aside the vasectomy and tubal ligation cards from the method options.
Tell the client that permanent methods may be suitable.

fields.label: ASK: Is the woman currently breastfeeding?
ASK: Is your child less than six months old?

fields.text:
Explain that lactational amenorrhea method (LAM) is only good for people who are breastfeeding.
Set aside the LAM cards from the methods option.

Explain to the client that combined oral contraceptives (COC) may not be a good option at this time because COC use during breastfeeding reduces the quantity of breast milk and can decrease the duration of lactation
A breastfeeding woman should delay COC use until her baby is at least six months old.
Set aside the COC cards from the methods option.

fields.label: ASK: Does your partner support you in using family planning?

fields.text: Explain to the client that methods requiring cooperation from her partner such as standard days method and condoms should be suitable.

Explain to the client that methods requiring cooperation from her partner such as standard days method and condoms may not be suitable.
Set aside standard days methods and condoms.

fields.label: ASK: Are there any methods which you do not want to use or you have not tolerated in the past?
Choose the methods the client does not want to use from the following list:
Have you decided which method you want to use?

fields.text: Discuss any concerns the client has about family planning and answer any questions.

step8.title: Client Ready to choose a method

fields.label: ASK: Are you now ready to choose a method?

fields.text:
Tell the client that based on her/his responses, potential methods are listed below.
Ask the client to choose the method she/he would like to use.

Take out the brochure for the method chosen.
Go through the brochure with the client so that she/he understands all of its content.

fields.label: Are you speaking to:

fields.text:
Tell the man that the method he has chosen must be used by a woman.
Tell the man that at the end of this visit, you will schedule a follow-up visit in one week to meet with him and his female partner to choose a method suitable for her.

fields.label:
ASK: Can you explain why you chose this method and not other methods?
Was the client adequately able to explain her reason for choosing this method?

fields.text:
The client has chosen method which requires a referral to a health facility.
Tell the client you will give a referral to go to a health facility to get the method she/he has chosen.

Discuss the importance of using condoms while waiting to get the family planning method from the health facility.
Give the client condoms.

Explain the reason for giving the referral and explain where the nearest health facility is located.
Fill in the referral form. Scan QR code on the referral form.
Inform the client that you will follow up to make sure they got the service they were referred for

step16.title: Client chose method available through CHW

fields.text:
Tell the client she/he has chosen a method which you can give her/him to start using today.
Tell the client you will ask the following questions to ensure she/he is able to use the method safely.

fields.label: ASK: Have you had a child in the past 6 months whom you are breastfeeding?
ASK: Do you smoke more than 15 cigarettes per day?
ASK: Do you have frequent severe headaches, often on one side, that sometimes blur your vision?
ASK: Have you ever been told you have high blood pressure?
ASK: Have you ever been told you have diabetes (high sugar in your blood)?
ASK: Do you have any pain in your abdomen or are you taking medication for abdominal pain?
ASK: Are you breastfeeding a baby less than 6 weeks old?
ASK: Do you smoke more than 15 cigarettes per day?

fields.text: Look at the client’s skin and eyes. If they appear yellow,

fields.label: Do you have liver cirrhosis, liver disease or inflammation of the liver?
ASK: Have you ever had a stroke, blood clot in your legs or lungs, or heart attack?
ASK: Do you regularly take any pills for tuberculosis (TB), seizures (fits), ritonavir or any second line medication?
ASK: Have you ever been told you have a lump in your breast (or breast cancer)?

fields.text:
Explain that the client is able to start using the chosen method for family planning.
Use the client brochure to explain how to use the pills.

Tell the client that she cannot use this family planning method due to her health condition.
Ask the client if she would like to choose a different method.

Give the client condoms.
Explain that the client can receive free family planning information through her/his phone with m4RH (15014).
